DataLoader

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

dcm2array[source]

dcm2array(path_to_dicom_dir, sort_by_slice_location=True)

Transform DICOM data into numpy array.

Parameters

path_to_dicom_dir : str path to folder containing all dicom files for one patient sort_by_slice_location : bool if True, returning array will be ordered by slice location

Returns

pixel_array : arr 3D array containing pixel data from dicom files

Notes

This function will require GDCM to be already installed if the DICOM is compressed

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
# example usage:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data_path = '../data/knee/'
try:
    array = dcm2array(path_to_dicom_dir = data_path, sort_by_slice_location=True)
    plt.imshow(array[:,:,0])
    plt.show()
except:
    print('could not load array')

GDCM needs to be installed.
Try: conda install -c conda-forge gdcm
could not load array
